occurrences.text: He's not doing sound today, but Deuteronomy chapter 30, notice in verse number 10, and I'll finish with this passage. Notice the first word, if. Deuteronomy 30 and verse number 10. If. It's an important word. Just two letters in our English language, but oh, what a message they carry. If thou shalt hearken unto the voice of the Lord thy God. To keep his commandments and his statutes, which are written in this book of the law. And if, we see it again, thou turn unto the Lord thy God with all thine heart, with all thy soul. For this commandment, which I command thee this day, notice this, it is not hidden from thee, neither is it far off. Aren't you thankful that we have the word of God? We have it. I'm not saying this to pat myself on the back, but you ought to be thankful that you got a church and a pastor that preaches the word of God. Because the reality is that you can go long and far around this nation and you can find a dearth of good Bible preaching. I'm just saying, preach the Bible. Notice verse number 12.
